author: Natalie Evans
title: Where in the world is safe to go on holiday this summer? UK Government reveals no-go areas
text:
(Photo: Getty) 
Security status : We advise against all non-essential travel to Tunisia. 
In June 2015, 38 tourists were killed by a crazed ISIS gunman as they sunbathed on a beach resort in Sousse. UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
Security status : There is an increased threat of terrorism and extremist violence worldwide and this should be borne in mind by citizens living and working in the USA. 
The USA has also witnessed a number of mass shootings in recent years. TURKEY 
Security status : Exercise a high degree of caution. 
In the early hours of 1 January 2017, there was a major shooting attack in the Reina nightclub which resulted in a large number of casualties. If you are in Istanbul you should exercise extreme caution at all times, avoid crowded areas and those frequented by foreigners. FRANCE (Photo: Edward Berthelot/Getty Images) 
Security status : We advise you to exercise a high degree of caution. Citizens throughout France should exercise a high degree of caution, and follow the instructions of local authorities. SYRIA 
Security status : We advise against all travel to Syria. 
If you’re currently in Syria, we strongly advise you to leave immediately while this is still possible. Read More COSTA RICA 
Security status : We advise citizens in Costa Rica to exercise a high degree of caution. 
There is currently an outbreak of Zika Virus in Central and South America and the Caribbean. SPAIN (Photo: Reuters) 
Security status : We advise you to take normal precautions. 
There is a general threat from terrorism in Europe, and the threat in Spain is considered to be high. While there is a risk of indiscriminate attacks, targets could include areas frequented by tourists. PERU 
Security status : We advise you to exercise a high degree of caution. 
On 15 August 2016 authorities in Peru confirmed that a 5.4 magnitude earthquake was recorded in southern Peru, affecting Arequipa, a popular tourist destination. AUSTRALIA 
Security status : We advise you to take normal precautions. GREECE 
Security status : Given recent terrorist attacks in European cities, citizens are advised to follow the advice of police and local authorities and to exercise increased vigilance. 
Attacks could occur at any time and could target tourist attractions, restaurants, transport hubs or other public areas. UNITED ARAB EMIRATES 
Security status : If you’re planning a trip to the UAE, we advise you to exercise a high degree of caution. 
There is considered to be a high threat from terrorism. You should remain vigilant at this time. 
The UAE is a Muslim country. Laws and customs are very different to those in UK and other western countries. POLAND 
Security status : We advise you to take normal precaution EGYPT (Photo: Getty Images) 
Security status : We advise citizens in Egypt to Exercise a High Degree of Caution.Holidaymakers travelling to the Red Sea coastal resorts of Sharm El Sheikh are advised to avoid travelling outside of these resorts. MOROCCO 
Security status : We advise you to exercise a high degree of caution in Morocco. 
There is a high risk of terrorism in Morocco which may target places popular with tourists such as hotels, bars and beaches. LUXEMBOURG 
Security status : We advise you to take normal precautions. GERMANY (Photo: WENN.com) 
Security status : While Germany remains a popular destination for citizens, visitors should be aware that a global risk of indiscriminate terror attacks also applies to Germany. 
We continue to advise visitors to Germany to exercise normal precautions. BELGIUM 
Security status : We advise you to exercise a high degree of caution. 
Multiple explosions occurred in Brussels on 22 March 2016 and there remains a heightened security presence on the streets. IRAQ (Photo: REUTERS) 
Security status : Do not travel. 
We advise against all travel to Iraq because of the extremely dangerous security situation and very high threat of terrorist attacks. If you’re currently in Iraq, we advise you to leave immediately. 
If you consider your presence in Iraq to be absolutely essential, you should have adequate and continuous professional security arrangements and ensure they are regularly reviewed. MALTA 
Security status : Attacks could occur at any time and could target tourist attractions, restaurants, transport hubs or other public areas. 
For a full list go to https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/foreign-commonwealth-office and click on the country you are travelling to in the Travel Advice section. Like us on Facebook
